content: note this piece not worked in spiral each round will be joined by a sl into 1st stitch followed by a chain 1 to begin the next round to avoid a traveling seam work 1st single_crochet of each round in the same stitch in which you work your chain 1 this will give you a straight seam round 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook join round with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 6 single_crochet round 2 chain 1 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 6 single_crochet round 3 chain 1 1 single_crochet in first 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in each of next 3 single_crochet single_crochet in last single_crochet join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 9 single_crochet round 4 chain 1 * 2 single_crochet in first single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat from * 3 times single_crochet in last single_crochet join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 13sc round 5-9 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 13 single_crochet embroider nose according to fig 3 remember seam is bottom of head round 10 chain 1 1 single_crochet in each of next 5 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in each of next 3 single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of next 5 single_crochet join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 16sc round 11 chain 1 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 16sc insert eyes into top of head seam is bottom side between stitches in round 10 and stuff with fiberfill be careful not to overstuff as this will distort the head shape round 12 chain 1 * 2 single_crochet decrease 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat from * 4 times single_crochet in last single_crochet join with sl into 1st single_crochet of round 11 single_crochet round 13 chain 1 2 single_crochet decrease 5 times single_crochet in last single_crochet 6 single_crochet stuff if necessary finish off using tail to sew hole in back of head shut ears make 2 chain 3 turn single_crochet in each back bar of chain - see fig 4 3 single_crochet without turning single_crochet in through two unworked loops of each chain stitch 3 single_crochet finish off leaving a long tail to sew to head weave ends of original tail from making chains into backs of ears © andrea moberly 2008 finishing sewing 1 sew front and back legs to body/neck according to photo at top of pattern 2 fold pipe cleaner in half and insert into neck down into body along where the spine would go leaving some sticking out of the top to insert into head 3 place head seam side down onto pipe cleaner and sew head in place 4 sew ears to sides of head according to fig 3 two row behind eyes on sides of head 5 weave in all ends embellishments 1 horns a cut a loop of darker yarn approximately 6 inches
